core.pg.datatypes.prototype module¶

Copyright (C) 2014 Bradley Alan Smith

Module implements the prototype of a Datatype, which encapsulates how to handle a specific datatype on the platform.

class core.pg.datatypes.prototype.Datatype[source]¶

Bases: object

A datatype represents a datatype that can be stored in the database and used on the platform. Encapsulates the SQL for creating, the SQL for selecting a column of the type as a target, as well as functions for converting to/from JSON, as well as instantiation of complex platform types (such as geographic via Shapely).

from_literal(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Instantiates the value from parameters provided

objid[source]¶
sql_create = None¶
sql_target(colid, colname)[source]¶

Given a column objid and column name, returns the SQL text to properly format and alias the query results for the column.

Module contents¶

Copyright (C) 2014 Bradley Alan Smith

Module implements datatypes for the platform - handles serialization and database interaction (encapsulates SQL for creating, formatting and aliasing the datatypes).
